intro: Sida anomala var. mexicona, commonly known as Mexican sida, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant features alternate, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces and produces small, white to pale pink flowers. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and agricultural fields. Its fibrous roots and rapid growth make it a common weed in many regions.
